supporting_text: The NAP outlines a One Health approach that integrates human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP includes specific strategies aimed at improving human health outcomes related to AMR.
The NAP addresses animal health through targeted actions to reduce AMR in livestock.
The NAP includes strategies to mitigate environmental impacts related to AMR.
The NAP outlines actions to ensure food security while addressing AMR in agricultural practices.
The NAP specifies the establishment of a reporting mechanism to monitor progress annually.
The NAP sets specific targets to be achieved by 2025.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and monitoring antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines a budget allocation for implementing its strategies against AMR.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for various AMR activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral task force to coordinate AMR efforts.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen laws and regulations governing antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines educational initiatives aimed at increasing AMR awareness in medical training.
The NAP includes public awareness campaigns to engage communities in AMR prevention.
The NAP emphasizes international collaboration with organizations like WHO and FAO.
The NAP includes strategies for developing AMR surveillance systems and data collection tools.
The NAP outlines actions to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance.
The NAP includes specific strategies for sanitation and infection prevention.
The NAP commits to implementing international AMR control standards and guidelines.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP mandates the rational use of antibiotics through specific regulations.
The NAP includes participation in international research collaborations for new AMR solutions.
